availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: J. W. Crawford (Deputy Sheriff of Livingtson County, Ky)

body.p: December 20, 1831. Physician and surgeon. Native of Livingston County. Worked as a teacher for four years. Appointed deputy sheriff of Livingston County, under James K. Huey. Entered the Miami Medical College at Cincinnati in 1856. In 1857 he became a student of the St. Louis Medical College, from which he graduated the latter part of the same year. Served from 1857-1877 in Livingston. Married December 25, 1860, to Elizabeth Frazier, daughter of Jesse and Polly Padon, of Livingston County. Children included Fannie F. (wife of A.C. Gilbert), Mary W. (wife of Robert Dean), Carrie Lee, Elizabeth, Jesse P., Sarah E., John F., William Henry.

bibl.p: J. H. Battle, W. H. Perrin, & G. C. Kniffin, Kentucky: A History of the State (Louisville:Battey Publishing, 1885).
